Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is thickly covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior (now very worn) is covered with a brown slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393280) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393280)
